Articles.Content:
This isn't the one you already know for example: 1 kerbal with a shovel in the background without a helmet along in the next page the 3 kerbals looking at the wreckage.

This isn't like it,when loading a new career I saw a spacecraft with lights over passing in the air please anybody give me a link and please do not close this thread I want to know more it's a spacecraft flying over with lights beaming down I need to know!
I couldn't send a screenshot it was moving over the land of the moon sorry but if you could see it you would know what to say!
Well, so we wait for evidence of this...
Here is what I saw a flying spacecraft's shadow with lights moving to right of the screen
No pics, no clicks, man! I'm inclined to believe it's something, and I do think the devs probably added a new easter egg or two in .24.

I've seen both of these things, it helps when your making mods and have to restart 200 times a day. The no-helmet thing I only saw once (and it was kind-of creepy), but the search light thing I've seen a number of times.

Edit: I guess the reason these threads keep getting closed is because these have all been addressed about 50 times a little further down the list: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/88286

Edited August 11, 2014 by DMagic

Are you using any mods? Also, if you could see the spacecraft, did it look like it has the same style of the game(usually mods don't have parts or UIs that look like they belong)?

Edited August 11, 2014 by Rthsom

I've seen both of these things, it helps when your making mods and have to restart 200 times a day. The no-helmet thing I only saw once (and it was kind-of creepy), but the search light thing I've seen a number of times.

Edit: I guess the reason these threads keep getting closed is because these have all been addressed about 50 times a little further down the list: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/88286

Indeed. On top of that, you can refer to this post specifically to see exactly what's going on.

Needless to say, as this is the latest in a long line of several duplicate topics on the subject, I'll be closing this thread. Feel free to continue any further discussion in the thread that's already been linked, and have a nice day
